oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tintype of James Bell Hollis, Sr.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. James Bell Hollis, Sr., served in Co. G, 8th Tenn. (Smith's) Cav., CSA. He wore a battle shirt and was armed with large straight-bladed knife and a flintlock military musket, probably Model 1822. He was captured at Buck Springs in April 1863. He was sent from Nashville to Louisville, Ky., then to City Point, Va. on May 7, 1863. Later captured at Villa Rica, Ga. on Sept. 15, 1864, he was sent to Louisville, then Camp Douglass, Ill., and discharged from the hospital June 22, 1865.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Hollis, James Bell
